results.title: Adolescence: a case study
results.brief_description: A study of adolescence as a time of change. Explores the life of Angie, a 17 year old high school student. Shows her at home, at school and with friends. Dr John Flavell talks about Piaget’s concept of “formal operations” and explains mental development in adolescence.

results.title: Adolescence and learning disabilities (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Thomas G. Gregory and Lawren Productions
results.brief_description: Promotes general guidelines for understanding and helping the teenager with learning problems. Interviews professionals and specialists who deal with learning-disabled teenagers, and with the adolescents themselves.

results.title: Adolescence
results.creator_credit: Daniel Riche, Philippe d'Argila and M K Productions
results.brief_description: A young girl takes ballet lessons with the Princess Troubetzkoy, a very old yet still famous ballerina. One day, she auditions for a ballet company, but another girl gets the job. So the girl goes back to the Princess to continue her studies. A sensitive study of an adolescent ballerina. With Sonia Petrovna and Madame Egorowa.

results.title: Adolescence
results.creator_credit: Garry Dunstan, Pat Hunder and It's About Time for SBS Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Not suitable for adults”.
A lighthearted exploration of the confusion and uncertainties surrounding adolescence through the eyes of 16 year olds from diverse backgrounds. Introduces the characters Tube, Gull, Curtis, Joey, Rosetta, Angela, Pepper and Gloria. Vignettes address “finding yourself, liking yourself and being your own person”, independence vs. limitations, the “real me”, friendships, peer group pressure and the physical/emotional changes occuring during the early teenage years. Similarly, the pressure of uncertain job prospects, school stresses, youthful dreams and concern for the world’s future.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Garry Dunstan, Pat Hunder and It’s About Time for SBS Television

results.title: Adobe village: valley of Mexico
results.creator_credit: Joseph Brun, Louis De Rochemont and Louis de Rochemont Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth and it’s peoples”.
Built on a swamp at a high altitude, modern Mexico City was built on the Aztec city of Teotihuacan by the Spanish who invaded the region. This documentary follows a typical Mexican family in an adobe village, weaving serapes, harvesting corn and raising cattles, sheep, horses, goats and donkeys. Discusses their diet, education, work and family life. Also attempts to explain how Aztec Indian culture has ‘blended’ with Spanish culture.

results.title: Admission impossible
results.creator_credit: Alec Morgan, Chris Oliver and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The very first Act passed by Australia’s first parliament was a law to exclude non-white races from Australia. “Admission impossible” is the true story of the behind-the-scenes political forces and propaganda that created the infamous White Australia Policy which was enforced until 1972. Eyewitness accounts and recently discovered confidential documents reveal how immigration officers carried out racial selectivity to discriminate against Asians, Jews and non-European applicants. The last part of the program discusses the impact the Vietnam War had on the reversal of this policy.

results.title: ADMA for short
results.creator_credit: Ronnie Anscombe, James Carr, British Petroleum and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: The building of ADMA enterprise, a special oil drilling platform developed for underwater oil exploration. Exploring for oil on the bed of the Persian Gulf involved the development of this floating platform in a shipyard on Kiel Canal, and the transformation of Das Island, an uninhabited outcrop of rock in the Persian Gulf, into an outpost of industrial civilisation, complete with harbour, airstrip, living quarters and workshops.
